summary.p: Ulakanīti (literally "The right conduct in the world") by Ulakanātar (17th c. at the latest) is a didactic work containing aphorisms on good conduct in the form of don'ts. The present version consists in ten numbered sections of eight lines each.
Description based on the examination of the original manuscript (May 2021).
Dimensions assessed at the time of examination.

filiation.p: BnF: Indien 76 (U2), Indien 386 (no. 4). Halle (Francke Foundations): Tam 89 B; Tam 100.

collation.desc: 1 folio = Ulakanīti: Title Page. No foliation. Verso blank. Shelfmark on recto. Two hands: hand #1 (major) and hand #2 (minor; addition in left margin).
1 folio = Ulakanīti: Invocation. No foliation. Verso blank. Hand #1 (major).
5 folios = Ulakanīti: Text. Tamil foliation 1-4, {5}. Hand #1 (major).

handNote.desc: Hand #2 (minor); hand different from the main hand (hand #1, major).

additions.desc: BnF shelfmark sticker: INDIEN 77 (front cover, recto).

binding.p: Pinewood covers apparently fabricated in the BnF.

origin.origDate: Dated to circa 1840 by Vinson (1868) and to 1840 by Cabaton (1912), on unstated grounds (presumably palaeographical and material analysis arguments).

Sweetman, Will & R. Ilakkuvan. 2012. The Bibliotheca Malabarica: Bartholomäus Ziegenbalg’s Tamil Library: An Annotated edition and translation. Pondicherry: EFEO and IFP. (Indologie no. 119) ― See p. 111.

Vinson, Julien. 1868. Manuscrits tamouls. Proofreadings of the catalogue for Tamoul 1-204 (old shelfmark). Printed by the atelier oriental de l’Imprimerie nationale. BnF “4-IMPROR-77 (B)”. — The same proofreadings with black ink handwritten corrections are found in Vinson et al. (1866-, f1-f49). — See p. 23.

encodingDesc.p: General ― Unmarked length of ō and ē supplied. Unmarked puḷḷi supplied. Conjectural reading (text unclear) between parentheses. Supplied reading (text lost) between square brackets. Alternative readings separated by slash. In transliteration ― Unmarked elided overshort u supplied as an apostrophe. Uppercase for initial vowels. Symbols between curly brackets. Abbreviations ― c = column; f = folio; lf = library foliation; lm = left margin; r = recto; rm = right margin; u / U followed by a number = unit (codicological and/or textual); v = verso.
